Posts.Content: Dec 5, 2015 08:06AM awarmrainyday wrote: Hi BarredOwl, thanks for your response. I have seen a copy of my radiology report and that is one of the things I find to be so alarming. The two tumors that they saw from last time have minimal changes (yay!) but they didn't find the other tumor at all and are now talking about a lymph node. Do tumors just disappear? I have an MRI scheduled for the 15th with and without contrast so that will hopefully answer any questions and put my mind at ease. I have not asked about seeing a genetic counselor, I've never really thought about that before. I just may ask my surgeon about that when we follow up on the MRI. If the MRI comes out okay I believe my next step (I'll probably do this either way) will be to see my gyn about the birth control I'm on. I've been on a high dose (Sprintec) since a miscarriage in 2010 and I've been finding more and more info about it's health implications, including increasing breast cancer risk by up to 20%. Considering my history with breast tumors already I'd like to get far, far away from this pill. Thanks again for your great advice! awarmrainyday
Posts.Title: Surgeons don't know what's wrong awarmrainyday alicki
